Class model.NormalBomb

java.lang.Object
object.Bomb
model.NormalBomb
public class model.NormalBomb extends object.Bomb
The model.NormalBomb class represents a standard stationary bomb that explodes in place after its countdown reaches zero. When it explodes, it destroys nearby tiles in a 3x3 radius.

This type of bomb does not move. Once placed by the model.Hero, it waits until detonation and then affects its surrounding tiles. The bomb can also damage the model.Hero if they are standing too close to the blast.

  • Constructor Details

    • model.NormalBomb

      public model.NormalBomb(int rowIndex, int colIndex, int stepsTilExplosion)
      Constructs a model.NormalBomb at the specified board position.
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - the row where the bomb is placed
      colIndex - the column where the bomb is placed
      stepsTilExplosion - ignored parameter (countdown is fixed to 4)

      The explosion timer is always set to 4 turns because the initial placement by the model.Hero already consumes one turn.

  • Method Details

    • explode

      public void explode(model.GameBoard board, model.Hero hero)
      Causes the bomb to explode, destroying nearby tiles and potentially damaging the model.Hero if they are within the blast radius.

      The blast radius extends one tile in every direction from the bomb (both cross and diagonal). After exploding, the bomb deactivates and allows the model.Hero to plant another bomb.

      Parameters:
      board - the game board on which the explosion occurs
      hero - the hero who may be affected by the blast

    • getType

      public char getType()
      Returns the display character for this bomb.
      Specified by:
      getType in class object.Bomb
      Returns:
      'B' representing a normal stationary bomb
